name: Qat'Muk Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area
Governance authority: Ktunaxa Nation Council, the Government of Canada, the Province of British Columbia and Nature Conservancy of Canada
Primary objectives: Biodiversity conservation; Preservation of cultural and spiritual values
planned actions: to create a new area-based measure;  effective long-term management
description: The Ktunaxa Nation Council envisions the IPCA area spanning about 170,000 acres immediately north of the Purcell Wilderness Conservancy and encompassing the Jumbo Valley and parts of adjacent watersheds. Dialogue between the parties is ongoing to refine the boundaries and stewardship objectives, and to consult with other stakeholders. The goal is for the Qat’muk Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area to be formally established by mid- 2021.

TYPE: Expand an existing area-based measure; create a new area-based measure
name: Growing Mongolia's Protected Area Estate
Governance authority: TNC provide the Government of Mongolia with technical assistance that led the Mongolian Parliament
planned actions: to improve management of an existing area-based measure

name: Thaidene Nene National Park Reserve and Territorial Protected Area
Governance authority: Government of the Northwest Territories and the Łutsël K’é Dene First Nation,
Primary objectives: Biodiversity conservation;Preservation of cultural and spiritual values
planned actions: to expand an existing area-based measure
description: Ongoing efforts continue to complete the Thaidene Nene Wildlife Conservation Area, which will add an additional 730,000 acres to this vast protected area.

name: The Badger-Two Medicine
Primary objectives: Biodiversity conservation; Preservation of cultural and spiritual values; Preservation of traditional livelihoods
planned actions: to extend the planned lifespan of an existing area-based measure
description: The Badger-Two Medicine is a place of deep cultural and spiritual significance to the Blackfeet Nation.

name: Edéhzhíe Dehcho Protected Area and National Wildlife Area
Primary objectives: Biodivesity conservation; preservation of traditional livelhioods
description: establish an Indigenous guardians program to conduct on-the-ground co-management of the 3.5 million acre Edéhzhíe National Wildlife Area.

name: Balhaf Headland Marine Area
description: conserving the marine area of the industrial site

name: Lizards’ Lane
description: protection of the source of spring water

name: Montserrat-Catalunya
description: management of a large forested area

name: Kep Archipelago Hope Spot
description: The Marine Conservation Cambodia (MCC), works through research, direct conservation practices and local activism to reverse some of the negative impacts. There are multiple actions to the work of MCC from dedicated species research, protection activities, habitat restoration, fisheries managment and policy activities and awarness raising activities.

name: Datan Algal Reef Hope Spot
Primary objectives: Biodiversity conservation; Preservation of cultural and spiritual values
description: The algal reef along the Taoyuan coast is a traditional fishing ground for local villages, providing a food source and income outside of the major rice farming seasons.  The Datan algal reef is perhaps the area’s healthiest in terms of reef structure, coverage, and biodiversity, making it incredibly vital to shield it from suffering the same fate as its surrounding reefs. The Datan algal reef is the largest biotic structure, thus providing its reef-associated species a connection to northern populations in Japan. However, the reef is highly degraded and still unnder threat. It is estimated that about 75% of the reef (the northern region of the reef) has been damaged by industrial pollution in the last 50 years.

name: Salisbury Island Hope Spot
description: Remote ecosystem through observation and promote virtual tourism here rather than physical tourism to minimize the human impact on this sensitive location. Conservationists working for Finding Salisbury, Inc. are seeking official government protection to maintain the area’s stable condition with a comprehensive no-take state marine reserve and a “virtual tourism” program to allow the public virtual access while keeping the area wild.

name: Kimbe Bay Hope Spot
planned actions: to improve management of an existing area-based measure
description: The Kimbe Bay battles the negative effects of local human population growth, the expansion of offshore fishing efforts, seabed mining, pollution and warming water temperatures. Hope Spot Champions Cecilie Benjamin and Gemma Galbraith and the students of Marine Environment Education Program (MEEP) are leading the cause to improve enforcement of the area’s LMMAs (Locally Managed Marine Areas) and MPAs and to expand their program to continue educating Kimbe Bay’s youth about reef conservation.

name: Whale and Dolphin Sanctuary of Uruguay Hope Spot
planned actions: to improve management of an existing area-based measure
description: The Whale and Dolphin Sanctuary of Uruguay has been declared a Hope Spot by international nonprofit Mission Blue in recognition of its value as a safe haven for cetaceans, to establish an enforceable policy to thoroughly manage and protect the sanctuary and to educate the public about the negative effects of “ocean noise” on marine life created by oil drilling, shipping and seismic testing.
